communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Composite Sketch Released June 15, 2016
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any information on the previously unreleased composite sketch jointly released by the Sacramento County Sheriff's Department and the FBI at a press conference on June 15, 2016. Specifically, I would like to know which case the composite sketch came from. There were 3 composite sketches released to the public at the press conference. The first one came from the 2/2/1978 Maggiore homicide and was released to the public on April 16, 1978. The second one came from the Rod Miller shooting and had been released sometime after 2001.  The third one had been previously unreleased and I would like to know which case the composite sketch came from.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Neville

title: Seattle Digital Kiosks: SDOT Permits, Hardware Specs, and Accessibility Reviews (2nd attempt)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Seattle Digital Kiosks: SDOT Permits, Hardware Specs, and Accessibility Reviews (2nd attempt)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2024:

1. All applications, permits (drafts and final versions), and associated review documents related to the installation and placement of interactive digital kiosks by IKE Smart City/Downtown Seattle Association in the public right-of-way.
2. Detailed hardware specifications for the exact IKE kiosk model(s) proposed for deployment in Seattle, including datasheets for all embedded cameras, microphones, and sensors (e.g., Wi-Fi/Bluetooth tracking, pedestrian counters), whether currently intended for activation or not.
3. Any internal or external reviews, assessments, or guidelines used or produced by SDOT concerning the accessibility (including but not limited to compliance with ADA or pedestrian clear zones) of the proposed digital kiosk installations.
4. All correspondence (including emails and attachments) between SDOT staff and the Office of the Mayor, the Seattle Disability Commission, the Seattle Design Commission, the Downtown Seattle Association, or IKE Smart City regarding the design, placement, permitting, or accessibility of interactive digital kiosks.

Please note that I requested these records on May 23, 2025, more than eight months ago, via request C226784-052325.  The delay is unreasonable.  The public cannot contribute meaningfully to discourse about these kiosks if the government withholds details of them--all public record--for many months.  I cannot believe that staff assigned to the digital kiosk project do not have a file for related materials that you could prepare and deliver in hours.

I WILL PAY UP TO $20 FOR PROCESSING OF THIS REQUEST.  Please inform me if you expect total charges to surpass that amount.  Please do not  bill me sporadically for trivial amounts.  Please do not hide your notice of payment due among pages of the same boiilerplate language that you send with messages which do not indicate a payment due.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Phil Mocek

title: CPRA Request: Dispatch Logs and Incident Reports - 1/22/26 535 Alameda St

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request: Dispatch Logs and Incident Reports - 1/22/26 535 Alameda St
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an inspection or copies of public records related to a specific police action that occurred on January 22nd, 2026 at approximately 1:30 PM.

The incident took place at 535 Alameda Street, Los Angeles CA, 90012, outside of the Metropolitan Detention Center. At least 11 LAPD cars pulled up to the loading dock for the Metropolitan Detention Center on Alameda street. Six or seven cars then parked right outside of the loading dock in the driveway of the MDC, while some parked along Alameda. Several officers were seen running from their cars towards and into the loading dock at MDC on Alameda street.

I am requesting the following records associated with this incident:

911 Call for Service logs and/or Dispatch (CAD) logs showing the nature of the call and the reason for the police response, Watch Commander logs or Daily Activity Reports referencing this specific location and time, 911 audio, and any associated incident or arrest reports regarding the police activity at 535 Alameda Street, Los Angeles CA, 90012, on January 22, 2026 in the aforementioned time frame.

If this resulted in a "Critical Incident" as defined by SB 1421 or AB 748, I request all relevant Body-Worn Camera (BWC) footage.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format to avoid duplication costs. If any portion of these records is deemed exempt from disclosure, please provide the non-exempt portions and a written explanation for any redactions, citing the specific code sections.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Lehman

title: Inventory Index of M.G.L. c. 121A and 121B Agreements (Machine-Readable)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Inventory Index of M.G.L. c. 121A and 121B Agreements (Machine-Readable)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Chapter 121A §6A Contract Inventory (Current and Historical)

A complete list, index, or database export of all entities that are or have been parties to a contract with the City of Boston under M.G.L. c. 121A, §6A, including at minimum:

-Legal entity name
-Associated parcel ID(s) / assessing account number(s)
-Commencement date
-Termination or cease date (if applicable)
-Status (active / expired / transferred)

Administrative necessity:
This inventory is required for reconciliation with the Massachusetts Department of Revenue, Bureau of Local Assessment 121A Project List (Locality Code 0035), which the City must verify for excise and distribution purposes. 

2. Annual January 15 Property Inventory Filings (Reporting Years 2023–2024)

Copies of all annual property acquisition lists, inventories, or equivalent submissions filed by Chapter 121A corporations with the Assessing Department pursuant to standard §6A contract terms requiring reporting by January 15 of each year.

This includes, but is not limited to, submissions required under provisions analogous to Section 18D of the Dudley Neighbors 1990 §6A Agreement.

3. Chapter 121B / Urban Renewal / PILOT Agreement Index

A complete list or index of all active and inactive agreements executed under M.G.L. c. 121B, including:

-and Disposition Agreements (LDAs)
-Cooperation Agreements
-PILOT / “Tax Agreement” instruments

For each agreement, please include:

-Agreement title
-Executing entity
-Parcel ID(s)
-Urban Renewal Area (if applicable)
-Effective date and expiration date

This request includes the full underlying dataset from which the City’s partial online disclosures (e.g., agreements posted on the Boston.gov “Tax Agreements” page) were derived.

4. Urban Renewal Plan Expiration and Parcel Tracking Schedule

Any schedule, table, database, or inventory used by BPDA to track:

-Urban Renewal Plan expiration dates
-Parcels subject to 121A and/or 121B authority within each plan

This includes records used to manage plan expiration, extension, or transition to underlying zoning authority.

5. Assessing Database Query Output (If No Stand-Alone List Exists)

If the records above are not maintained as a single consolidated document, please produce the results of a database query from the Assessing Department’s CAMA system (e.g., iasWorld or equivalent) showing all parcels or accounts flagged with tax classification codes corresponding to:

-Chapter 121A
-Chapter 121B
-PILOT / Tax Agreement status

Format and Production

-Please provide records in machine-readable format (CSV, Excel, or equivalent).
-If responsive records exist in multiple systems or formats, please produce each in its native digital form.
If no responsive records exist for any item, please affirmatively state that no such records exist and identify the systems searched.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Possible FBI Surveillance of prior graduate Kevin Riford

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Possible FBI Surveillance of prior graduate Kevin Riford
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To the University at Buffalo FOIL Officer,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law, Article 6), I am requesting access to and copies of any records held by the University at Buffalo that reference, discuss, or relate to FBI surveillance, monitoring, or involvement concerning prior UB graduate Kevin Riford.

This request includes, but is not limited to, records from January 1, 2018, to the present that:

• Reference the FBI in connection with Kevin Riford
• Discuss alleged or actual monitoring, surveillance, or tracking involving Kevin Riford
• Reflect communications between University at Buffalo faculty, staff, administrators, campus security, or University Police and the FBI concerning Kevin Riford
• Document any referrals, reports, or inquiries made to or received from the FBI regarding Kevin Riford

For context, this request relates to statements and events described in the following article, which is published publicly:
[https://rifordmedia.com/kevins-story-the-professor-the-russian-deportation-and-the-monitoring-claim/](https://rifordmedia.com/kevins-story-the-professor-the-russian-deportation-and-the-monitoring-claim/)

If you would like audio/video to help assist with this request, please let us know.

If any records are withheld or redacted, please identify the specific statutory basis for each denial or redaction and release any reasonably segregable portions.

I request that all responsive records be provided electronically, if available. If there are any fees associated with this request, please notify me prior to processing.

Thank you for your attention to this request.

communications.subject: El Cajon Public Records Request for Police Department No. PRR26-90, Topic: General
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the El Cajon Police Department. We have received your request for information and will begin processing it. A response to this request will be sent in a timely manner as allowed by California Government Code Section 7922.535.  In unusual circumstances, that time period may be extended an additional 14 days. We make every effort to respond to requests for information as quickly as possible. Normal business hours (lobby open to public) are: 
Monday-Thursday, 8:00am-5:00pm, and every other Friday, 9:00am-5:00pm. To check on the status of your request, return to the Public Records site and click on Lookup Request. *NOTE: At "Lookup Request", enter the tracking number, and click on the Submit button (Enter key will not work). You will be prompted for this tracking number, PRR26-90, along with your email, 203903-36019829@requests.muckrock.com

title: Office of Technology and Innovation chatbot logs under Mayor Mamdani

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Office of Technology and Innovation chatbot logs under Mayor Mamdani
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Chat histories of all ChatGPT, Copilot or other AI chatbot service sessions conducted by employees on city-owned devices or used in job-related functions in the department.

The timeframe for this request is from January 1, 2026 to the date this request is processed. Please make records available in installments as they are ready to release.

If it’s helpful, please share with respondents the following instructions for exporting ChatGPT histories:

**Click on your name or profile icon** (bottom-left corner of the ChatGPT interface).
Select **”Settings”**.
Go to the **”Data Controls”** tab.
Click **”Export data”**.
A pop-up will appear — click **”Confirm export”**.
OpenAI will email you a download link with a `.zip` file containing your chat history in JSON format (and HTML for easy viewing).

I could not readily find an efficient way of exporting Copilot logs --- however, there seems to be a way to do it with an administrator-level Microsoft account, if that exists within the department. Please let me know what is possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mia Shou

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2026-858-00045 Submitted to NYC Office of Technology and Innovation (OTI)
communications.communication:
Your request FOIL-2026-858-00045 has been successfully submitted to the NYC Office of Technology and Innovation (OTI).
                                The details of your request are shown below. 
 
Request Title: Office of Technology and Innovation chatbot logs under Mayor Mamdani 
 
Request Description: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Chat histories of all ChatGPT, Copilot or other AI chatbot service sessions conducted by employees on city-owned devices or used in job-related functions in the department.

The timeframe for this request is from January 1, 2026 to the date this request is processed. Please make records available in installments as they are ready to release.

If it’s helpful, please share with respondents the following instructions for exporting ChatGPT histories:

**Click on your name or profile icon** (bottom-left corner of the ChatGPT interface).
Select **”Settings”**.
Go to the **”Data Controls”** tab.
Click **”Export data”**.
A pop-up will appear — click **”Confirm export”**.
OpenAI will email you a download link with a `.zip` file containing your chat history in JSON format (and HTML for easy viewing).

I could not readily find an efficient way of exporting Copilot logs --- however, there seems to be a way to do it with an administrator-level Microsoft account, if that exists within the department. Please let me know what is possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mia Shou

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2206138/

title: Christina Little Riford - 48 Claremont Ave, Tonawanda, NY - Complaint #24-423978 - (June 6, 2024) - "Welfare Check"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To the Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law, Article 6), I respectfully request copies of all records related to **Complaint #24-423978**, received on or about **June 6, 2024**, involving a police response described as a “check welfare” for Christina Little Riford at or near ** 48 Claremont Avenue, Town of Tonawanda**.

This request includes, but is not limited to:

1. The complete incident report, including any narratives, supplements, follow-up reports, and disposition records
2. All Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) records, call logs, and time stamps associated with this incident

We've included a PDF copy of the complaint. 

If any portion of the requested records is withheld or redacted, please provide the statutory justification for each redaction as required under Public Officers Law §87(2), and release all reasonably segregable portions of the records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: JPD sUAS Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.  The Joplin Police Department's annual sUAS reports from 2017 to present.
2.  The location these reports are published


To provide context, we have reason to believe these records exist because the police department policy on use of sUAS devices states that an annual report shall be published. Policy located here. The relevant text is in paragraph 3 of section E:


3.  The Chief of Police or his or her designee shall publish an annual report documenting the agency’s deployment and use of sUAS devices.
    

We have been unable to locate these reports.

Since these reports are supposed to be easily accessible to the public we request the City waive all fees for this request. We request the City consider this request to waive fees despite the blanket policy of not waiving fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael

title: Request for Public Records - Determinations from Building Department

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Public Records - Determinations from Building Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All written communications prepared, issued, sent, drafted, or approved by the Town of Marlborough Building Department from May 1, 2025 to the present that state, reflect, or communicate the Building Department’s position, conclusion, finding, determination, interpretation, directive, or decision regarding any person, property, complaint, incident, alleged violation, application, permit, certificate, inspection, enforcement matter, or code-related issue (collectively, “Determination Records”), whether or not such documents are labeled or styled as a “determination.” This includes, but is not limited to, records pertaining to Buttermilk Falls Inn, 39 Main St., Orchards on the Hudson, or Marlborough Resort.

This request expressly includes, without limitation, any document styled or characterized as an “opinion,” “interpretation,” “finding,” “determination,” “decision,” “directive,” “notice,” “letter,” “email,” “memorandum,” “report,” or similar, and any transmittal that attaches, forwards, summarizes, or restates the substance of a Determination Record.

This request further includes all responsive records regardless of where maintained, including records created, transmitted, or stored using personal email accounts, personal mobile phones, text messaging, messaging applications, cloud services, or other non-Town devices or accounts, to the extent such records relate to Town business.

Upon completion of production, please certify in writing that the production is complete and that no additional responsive Determination Records exist within the custody or control of the Town, including records maintained on personal devices or accounts as described above.

If any records are withheld or redacted, please identify the statutory basis for each withholding with particularity, and identify the categories of records withheld and the date ranges covered.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mr. Churchill
